TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Randazzo said:
> 
> 
> Well, I'll be dipped. Are these recent changes, or did I imagine up rules for myself?
> 

Made up rules probably, I don't see any OP changes lately.

Congratulations to...

[ECarinae](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2353577) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with SP-M.

[Randazzo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2354169) Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with Kestrel III.

[Doctor Mandarb](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2355429) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with SSTO-MKIII.

EvermoreAlpaca - Advanced Pilot Precision Award with [Snack Delivery SSTO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2357267) (minimalist record holder 2.140t).

[stewis](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2359966) Utilitarial Commendation (45t), Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with SSTO 1.

... for completing the K-Prize successfully. Thanks all for your mission reports and welcome (back) to the K-Prize party guest list aka roll of honour.

ihtoit, thanks for your mission report. Just so you know, in case you didnt, refuelling is a gatecrasher event, see rules on first page first post, also a complete mission usually involves a landing / attempt! So since the mission wasnt complete I thought you were sharing R&D, say if you want that linked as a gatecrasher. If you intend to complete the mission then I will link that as and when.

One last space plane (yes I am addicted to KSP) this one can move 110t to 80km orbit and rendezvous with my space station with some fuel to spare.  This one wasn't really fun to fly home especially between 40km and 30km until moving  some fuel to the front to balance the craft out.

Total costs of fuel to orbit with max payload is 46,000.  (total cost is 293,000).

Don't think I will be building anything bigger although its great to fly and handles really well at lower altitudes.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/Q2KFL/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Also the craft files are below:

[SSTO CRAFT FILES](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/4tg0waoflnwzmx8/AADV3jMWaixr5MbIZ0L-GSbva?dl=0)

> ihtoit, thanks for your mission report. Just so you know, in case you didnt, refuelling is a gatecrasher event, see rules on first page first post, also a complete mission usually involves a landing / attempt! So since the mission wasnt complete I thought you were sharing R&D, say if you want that linked as a gatecrasher. If you intend to complete the mission then I will link that as and when.
> 

sure, link me as a gatecrasher for now, until I get landed. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") I might even do something spectacular like land on Minmus, now I've got a full tank.

OK, so as far as Im concerned I did it!!

There are a few pictures to follow with a brief description.

Should [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) disagree with anything I will remove the badge from my signature.

Other than that I'm over the Mun (so to speak). I've only been into planes for a little while so to me this achievement is huge ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

This is Kerbitious V.2

 on the runway ready for take off.........

![hwegqv.png](http://i66.tinypic.com/hwegqv.png)

Up, up and away......a step into the unknown....(for me anyway!)

![1z23nt1.png](http://i64.tinypic.com/1z23nt1.png)

Making an orbit......

![72379d.png](http://i65.tinypic.com/72379d.png)

Made it into orbit! Now (for me) the hard part......landing......

![2wd3ats.png](http://i64.tinypic.com/2wd3ats.png)

Coming in steady......steady......

![6f40n8.png](http://i65.tinypic.com/6f40n8.png)

Had NO idea what happened but ended up in a flat spin, burned off all my remaining dV, just made it over the mountains on the KSC approach but landed intact.

I could send out a refueling rover so I believe I've achieved the challenge. It was great fun anyway ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

![1zzng34.png](http://i67.tinypic.com/1zzng34.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-17T05:56:36Z" title="01/17/2016 05:56  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 17, 2016</time> by RA3236**

I managed to build a slightly bigger ssto that can get to duna. The mission video should have all my maneuvers. Nothing really special about this class other than it has some science equipment on it which I used to almost finish my tech tree (one away) in my career save.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bJujTF7o6xY?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

My first challenge submission.  This is what I call the Stingray.  It has actually flown 5 missions to orbit after its initial build.  It is based at the island airbase where I have a mining and fueling setup.  I would say landing this thing at the island with 2 other craft and the immense lag deserves a medal.  It ended up broken after this mission, the wings refused to stay on when attempting to take off again.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/2XV0o/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-21T07:10:01Z" title="01/21/2016 07:10  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 21, 2016</time> by ForScience6686**
  
I didn't know how to post pics

And once again it is my great privilege to announce the winners of the prestigious and highly sought after K-Prize. 

Congratulations to ...

manni01 - Expeditionary Astrokerbal Distinction (Duna), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with  [SSTO Sunder](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2367465).

stewis - Utilitarial Commendation (110t), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with [SSTO2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2362439).

[macceemiller](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2364477) with Kerbitious V.2.

[MagicFireCaster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2364774) Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with FRC-P01 Flying Mole.

[ForScience6686](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2372313) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Stingray.

... on winning the K-Prize and assorted honours for successfully completing the mission and returning home to Kerbin safely. Thanks all for your mission reports and welcome to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

Well it's not going to win any additional awards for originality or doing anything anyone hasn't done before, but I did my first proper SSTO mission since version 0.something last night, with the imaginatively named SSTO3a (1 and 2 were development aircraft and 3 had an issue with exploding payload), so figured I should do a mission report for it.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/XpGM6/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Spearhead-Port SSTO, intended for LKO service.

Warning: image-heavy

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/E4jvv/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Read an article about Flying Wing designs on the BBC website a few days ago and was fascinated by its history, so I decided to take an unstable prototype I designed to tow parasite spaceplanes into space and instead refine it to be airworthy and K-Prize capable.  Needless to say, Flying Wings are tricky, and it took me several days to solve the engines melting off, the flexing, the flat-spinning, the pitching problem, the excessive maneuverability problem, the fuel flow problem and the structural stability.  Thankfully my insistence on incorporating a high-thrust design negates any drag issues this SSTO no doubt suffers from.  This is probably the widest plane I've yet designed in this game.

[http://www.bbc.com/future/story/20160201-the-wwii-flying-wing-decades-ahead-of-its-time](http://www.bbc.com/future/story/20160201-the-wwii-flying-wing-decades-ahead-of-its-time)

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/pZzS0/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-13T07:39:34Z" title="02/13/2016 07:39  AM" data-short="8 yr">February 13, 2016</time> by Edax**

Whipped this up in half an hour. The Omega Project is pretty much me trying to build a small SSTO. Being sort of rushed, I was only able to get to Minmus and back to KSC with 3 units of fuel left. I also did a terrible job eyeballing the avionics which resulted in terrible gliding and kraken's bane for some reason throwing me down the entire runway after landing ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P").

First post!

Mission profile: Takeoff at KSC carrying miniature space station in payload bay. Release payload in 80x80km orbit, leaving a Kerbal to man it. Return to runway at KSC.

[RizzoTheRat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2391767) Utilitarial Commendation (x3 sats), Pilot Proficiency Medal with SSTO3a.

Gojira1000 - Astrokerbal Distinction (Minmus) with [Scooter](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2409536).

... for completing the K-Prize mission successfully. Thanks all for your mission reports and welcome to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list. 

Thanks also to SpaceplaneAddict for dobbing in Gojira1000 ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") and Gojira1000 if you want that mission linked as a gate crasher say so, it can be arranged but you are exempt from automatic gatecrasher listing due to having completed another mission (or two) successfully in this version.
